definition: victory is in sight

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
surname Li
sharp/favorable/advantage/benefit/profit/interest/to do good to/to benefit
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]

sentences.english: Republicans from Pennsylvania and New York are scenting victory.
sentences.chinese: 来自宾夕法尼亚州和纽约州的共和党人感到胜利在望。

sentences.english: Father, we are on the cusp of victory.
sentences.chinese: 父亲，我们已经胜利在望了。

in a spurt of energy
right under one's nose/right in front of one's eyes/close at hand/imminent
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
lit. fight with one's back to the river (idiom); fig. to fight to win or die
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
bitter struggle/hard battle/arduous effort
victory/CL:個|个[ge4]
to seize total victory (idiom); an overwhelming victory/to win by a landslide (in election)
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
lit. an arrow at the end of its flight (idiom)/fig. spent force
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
lit. to sharpen one's sword (idiom)/fig. to prepare to attack/to be getting ready for battle
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
